text: "We cannot conceive of any end or limit to the world, but always as of necessity it occurs to us that there is something beyond." -Francis Bacon
"The God who gave us life, gave us liberty at the same time; the hand of force may destroy, but cannot disjoin them." -Thomas Jefferson
"To love truth for truth's sake is the principal part of human perfection in this world, and the seed-plot of all other virtues." -John Locke
"If God did not exist, it would be necessary to invent him." -Voltaire
"I disapprove of what you say, but will defend to the death your right to say it." -Voltaire
Voltaire was the nom de plume used by Fran√ßois-Marie Arouet.
